Description: All accessions as a percent of average employment
New hires as a percent of average employment
Recall hires as a percent of average employment
All separations as a percent of average employment
Hires as a percent of average employment
Separations as a percent of average employment
Flows into stable employment as a percent of average stable employment

Indicator Name: New Hiring Rate (New Hires to Full-Quarter Status)
Description: New hires into stable employment as a percent of average stable employment

Indicator Name: Separation Rate (Flows out of Full-Quarter Employment)
Description: Flows out of stable employment as a percent of average stable employment

Indicator Name: Separation Rate in the Next Quarter (Flow out of Full-Quarter Employment)
Description: Flow rate out of stable employment in the next quarter
The rate at which stable jobs begin and end

Indicator Name: Firm Job Gain Rate (Job Creation Rate)
Description: Estimated number of jobs gained at firms throughout the quarter as a percent of average employment

Indicator Name: Firm Job Loss Rate (Job Destruction Rate)
Description: Estimated number of jobs lost at firms throughout the quarter  as a percent of average employment

Indicator Name: Firm Job Change Rate (Net Change Rate)
Description: Difference between firm job gain and firm job loss  as a percent of average employment
Replacement hires as a percent of  average  employment
Estimated number of full-quarter jobs gained at firms as a percent of average stable employment
Estimated number of full-quarter jobs lost at firms as a percent of average stable employment

Indicator Name: Firm Job Change Rate (Stable; Net Change Rate)
Description: Net growth in jobs that last a full quarter as a percent of average stable employment
